intro: Pinus decandolleana var. dependens, commonly known as the Mexican red pine, is a rare and endangered conifer native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, straight trunk and needle-like leaves that are typically arranged in bundles of five. The tree produces cones that are often pendulous, a feature that gives the variety its specific epithet "dependens." Its cones are typically reddish-brown and contain edible seeds that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to habitat loss and overexploitation, this species is critically endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
